alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Anderson, north central Knox and southwestern Union Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Knoxville, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Clinton, Halls, Norris, Andersonville, Powell, Paulette and Big Ridge State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
